intro: Ledothamnus jauaensis, commonly known as the Jauaensis ledothamnus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically simple and alternate, with a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in montane forests and grasslands.
